newsitem.title: USA: Glaxo, Ivax sign Easi-Breath pact.
newsitem.headline: Glaxo, Ivax sign Easi-Breath pact.

text.p: IVAX Corp said Monday that its subsidiary, Norton Healthcare Ltd, intends to enter a definitive licensing agreement with Glaxo Wellcome Plc for Ivax's Easbreathing device.
IVAX said its subsidiary has executed a memorandum of understanding with Glaxo for the deal, reflecting the parties' intent to sign a definitive license agreement by the end of 1996.

Though the financial terms of the working relationship established by the license agreement are confidential, IVAX said it will receive a combination of fixed payments and royalties. Fixed payments are expected to total about $72 million, of which a proportion will be paid in 1996.
In addition to these fixed payments, the agreement will provide for substantial additional annual volume/revenue related royalties which will continue for the duration of the license, IVAX said.
The proposed agreement will significantly expand terms of an existing IVAX/Glaxo Easi-Breathe agreement, which provides Glaxo with certain rights to the proprietary inhaler.
Under the proposed agreement, Glaxo Wellcome will license the right to use Easi-Breathe for its range of inhaled products and for products to which it has exclusive rights.

The license will grant Glaxo Wellcome the exclusive right to use Easi-Breathe for these compounds on a worldwide basis, except in certain countries where IVAX has pre-existing agreements for use of Easi-Breathe, a statement from IVAX said.
